org.smtlib

Class SymbolTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.smtlib.SymbolTable

  • public class SymbolTable
extends java.lang.Object
    This class manages a symbol table used for storing definitions and looking up ids in expressions. The table maps names to Entry objects that hold information about the defined symbol.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  SymbolTable.Entry
      An object that holds all the information about the defined symbol (or aliased definition).
      static class  SymbolTable.Iterator
      An iterator over all of the Symbols in the symbol scope stack from the top-most scope on down.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      boolean arrayTheorySet
      true if the Array theory has been set
      boolean bitVectorTheorySet
      true if the bit-vector theory has been set
      ILogic logicInUse
      The logic that is being used - this value is used to check that expressions, etc., conform to the language restrictions of the current logic.
      private java.util.Map<IExpr.IIdentifier,java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.List<SymbolTable.Entry>>> names
      The top-most Symbol scope
      boolean realsIntsTheorySet
      true if the RealsInts theory is set (which allows implicit promotion of ints to reals)
      SMT.Configuration smtConfig
      A reference to the Configuration for this instance of SMT.
      private java.util.Map<IExpr.IIdentifier,ISort.IDefinition> sorts
      The top-most Sort scope
      private java.util.List<java.util.Map<IExpr.IIdentifier,ISort.IDefinition>> sortStack
      The stack of Sort declaration scopes
      private java.util.List<java.util.Map<IExpr.IIdentifier,java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.List<SymbolTable.Entry>>>> symStack
      The stack of Symbol scopes

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SymbolTable(SMT.Configuration smtConfig)
      Constructs an empty symbol table
      SymbolTable(SymbolTable s)
      Makes a copy of the symbol table

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(SymbolTable.Entry entry)
      Adds the given entry to the symbol table.
      boolean add(SymbolTable.Entry entry, boolean overload)
      Adds the given entry to the symbol table; if overload is false and the identifier in the entry is already in the table, the method returns false (without changing the symbol table); otherwise the entry is added and the method returns true
      boolean addSortDefinition(IExpr.IIdentifier identifier, IExpr.INumeral arity)
      Adds a new sort declaration to the top frame
      boolean addSortDefinition(IExpr.IIdentifier identifier, java.util.List<ISort.IParameter> parameters, ISort definition)
      Adds a new sort abbreviation definition to the top frame
      boolean addSortParameter(IExpr.ISymbol symbol)
      Adds the given symbol as a sort to the top scope of the sort table; returns false if the given symbol is already in the top scope (and the sort table is unchanged); returns true if the symbol is not already in the top scope.
      void clear()
      Initializes the symbol table with an empty background frame and one empty frame.
      private boolean hasAttribute(SymbolTable.Entry entry, java.lang.String attr)
      Returns true if the entry contains a value for the given attribute name
      SymbolTable.Iterator iterator()
      Returns a fresh iterator over the symbol table's contents
      java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.List<SymbolTable.Entry>> lookup(IExpr.IIdentifier name)
      Lookup the Symbol with the given identifier, returning a Map of arity to List<Entry>.
      SymbolTable.Entry lookup(IExpr.IIdentifier name, java.util.List<ISort> argSorts, ISort resultSort)
      Lookup a Symbol with the given name and argument Sorts and result Sort.
      ISort.IFcnSort lookup(int arity, IExpr.IIdentifier name)
      Lookup the Symbol with the given identifier and arity, returning its Sort.
      ISort.IDefinition lookupSort(IExpr.IIdentifier name)
      Looks up the Sort definition with the given name
      void merge()
      Combines the top two symbol scopes, removing the current top scope; presumes that there is no shadowing of symbols; the top sort scope is discarded.
      void moveToBackground()
      Removes the previous background frame, then removes the top frame and inserts it as the bottom (background) frame.
      void pop()
      Removes the top frame from the symbol table stack.
      void push()
      Adds a new empty frame on the top of the symbol table stack.

        The logic that is being used - this value is used to check that expressions, etc., conform to the language restrictions of the current logic.

    • Method Detail

      • iterator

        public SymbolTable.Iterator iterator()
        Returns a fresh iterator over the symbol table's contents

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Initializes the symbol table with an empty background frame and one empty frame.

      • push

        public void push()
        Adds a new empty frame on the top of the symbol table stack.

      • merge

        public void merge()
        Combines the top two symbol scopes, removing the current top scope; presumes that there is no shadowing of symbols; the top sort scope is discarded.

      • pop

        public void pop()
        Removes the top frame from the symbol table stack. The symbol table must have at least one non-background scope or an InternalException will be thrown.

      • moveToBackground

        public void moveToBackground()
        Removes the previous background frame, then removes the top frame and inserts it as the bottom (background) frame.

      • addSortParameter

        public boolean addSortParameter(IExpr.ISymbol symbol)
        Adds the given symbol as a sort to the top scope of the sort table; returns false if the given symbol is already in the top scope (and the sort table is unchanged); returns true if the symbol is not already in the top scope.
        Parameters:
        symbol - the symbol to add
        Returns:
        true if successfully added, false if already present

      • addSortDefinition

        public boolean addSortDefinition(IExpr.IIdentifier identifier,
                        IExpr.INumeral arity)
        Adds a new sort declaration to the top frame
        Parameters:
        identifier - the identifier of the new Sort definition
        arity - the arity of the new Sort definition
        Returns:
        true if successfully added, false if there already is a sort (in any scope) with this identifier

      • addSortDefinition

        public boolean addSortDefinition(IExpr.IIdentifier identifier,
                        java.util.List<ISort.IParameter> parameters,
                        ISort definition)
        Adds a new sort abbreviation definition to the top frame
        Parameters:
        identifier - the name of the new Sort definition
        parameters - the names of the parameters of the Sort abbreviation
        definition - the expression of the Sort abbreviation
        Returns:
        true if successfully added, false if there already is a sort by this name in the top scope

      • lookupSort

        public ISort.IDefinition lookupSort(IExpr.IIdentifier name)
        Looks up the Sort definition with the given name
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the Sort definition to find
        Returns:
        null if not found

      • lookup

        public ISort.IFcnSort lookup(int arity,
                    IExpr.IIdentifier name)
        Lookup the Symbol with the given identifier and arity, returning its Sort.
        Parameters:
        arity - the arity of the Symbol
        name - the name of the Symbol
        Returns:
        null if not found, the Sort of the Symbol if found

      • lookup

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.List<SymbolTable.Entry>> lookup(IExpr.IIdentifier name)
        Lookup the Symbol with the given identifier, returning a Map of arity to List<Entry>.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the Symbol
        Returns:
        null if not found, the corresponding List<Entry> from the top-most scope in which the identifier is found

      • lookup

        public SymbolTable.Entry lookup(IExpr.IIdentifier name,
                       java.util.List<ISort> argSorts,
                       ISort resultSort)
        Lookup a Symbol with the given name and argument Sorts and result Sort.
        Parameters:
        name - the name to find
        argSorts - the Sorts of the arguments
        Returns:
        the result Sort

        private boolean hasAttribute(SymbolTable.Entry entry,
                   java.lang.String attr)
        Returns true if the entry contains a value for the given attribute name

        public void add(SymbolTable.Entry entry)
        Adds the given entry to the symbol table.
        Parameters:
        entry - the Entry to add

      • add

        public boolean add(SymbolTable.Entry entry,
          boolean overload)
        Adds the given entry to the symbol table; if overload is false and the identifier in the entry is already in the table, the method returns false (without changing the symbol table); otherwise the entry is added and the method returns true
        Parameters:
        entry - the Entry to add
